Module org.TRPGF
Package org.TRPGF

Class Dialog

java.lang.Object
org.TRPGF.Dialog
Direct Known Subclasses:
Choice
public class Dialog extends Object
This class handles everything to do with Dialog.

    Creates a dialog with a prerequisite option having to be chosen to be successful, where if you chose A get to go to B, if you did not choose A, you get routed to C this one ends the game based on if you did or did not pass

  • Method Details

    • getSingleInstance

      public static Dialog getSingleInstance()
      This instances a new dialog which you have to use for all the options and dialog.

    • createDialogBox

      public void createDialogBox​(int id, String content)
      Creates a dialog
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this dialog box
      content - is the text for this dialog for example: "Adventurer i need help!"

    • createDialogBoxWithImage

      public void createDialogBoxWithImage​(int id, String content, String imgUrl)
      Creates a dialog with an image
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this dialog box
      content - is the text for this dialog
      imgUrl - is the absolute path for an image

    • addOption

      public void addOption​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, int successDialogBoxId)
      Creates a dialog option, there can only be a maximum of 3 options per dialog.
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option, option id's are relative, so they have to be in order, and only use 1, 2 or 3.
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I will help you innkeeper!"
      successDialogBoxId - is the id of the next dialog on a successful choice

    • addOptionEnding

      public void addOptionEnding​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, int endingScreenID)
      Creates a dialog option which ends the game
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I will help you innkeeper!"
      endingScreenID - is the id of the ending that will be displayed when the option is chosen.

    • addOptionPrevious

      public void addOptionPrevious​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, int pChoiceId, int pDialogBoxId, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId)
      Creates a dialog with a prerequisite option having to be chosen to be successful, where if you chose A get to go to B, if you did not choose A, you get routed to C
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"
      pChoiceId - is the id of the previous option having to be chosen for it to go to successDialogBoxId
      pDialogBoxId - is the id of the previous dialog pChoiceId is in relation to
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you clear the requirements
      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements

    • addOptionPreviousEnding

      public void addOptionPreviousEnding​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, int pChoiceId, int pDialogBoxId, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId, boolean endOnSuccess, int endingScreenId)
      Creates a dialog with a prerequisite option having to be chosen to be successful, where if you chose A get to go to B, if you did not choose A, you get routed to C this one ends the game based on if you did or did not pass
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"
      pChoiceId - is the id of the previous option having to be chosen for it to go to successDialogBoxId
      pDialogBoxId - is the id of the previous dialog pChoiceId is in relation to
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you clear the requirements
      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements
      endOnSuccess - is a boolean value where true means the game ends if u clear the requirements, false means the game ends if u fail the requirements
      endingScreenId - is the id for the ending screen that will be shown

    • addOptionPreviousRequirement

      public void addOptionPreviousRequirement​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, int pChoiceId, int pDialogBoxId, String stat, int statVal, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId)
      Creates a dialog with a requirement of a stat having to be greater than or equal to n, in addition to having chosen an option beforehand
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"
      pChoiceId - is the id of the previous option having to be chosen for it to go to successDialogBoxId
      pDialogBoxId - is the id of the previous dialog pChoiceId is in relation to
      stat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!!
      statVal - is the value of what your stat has to be greater than or equal to >=
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you clear the requirements
      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements

    • addOptionPreviousRequirementEnding

      public void addOptionPreviousRequirementEnding​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, int pChoiceId, int pDialogBoxId, String stat, int statVal, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId, boolean endOnSuccess, int endingScreenId)
      Creates a dialog with a requirement of a stat having to be greater than or equal to n this ends the game
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"
      pChoiceId - is the id of the previous option having to be chosen for it to go to successDialogBoxId
      pDialogBoxId - is the id of the previous dialog pChoiceId is in relation to
      stat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!!
      statVal - is the value of what your stat has to be greater than or equal to >=
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you clear the requirements
      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements
      endOnSuccess - is a boolean value where true means the game ends if u clear the requirements, false means the game ends if u fail the requirements
      endingScreenId - is the id for the ending screen that will be shown

    • addOptionPreviousReward

      public void addOptionPreviousReward​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, int pChoiceId, int pDialogBoxId, String rewardStat, int rewardVal, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId)
      Creates a dialog with a reward for a stat, if you have chosen a specific option previouslyc
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"
      pChoiceId - is the id of the previous option having to be chosen for it to go to successDialogBoxId
      pDialogBoxId - is the id of the previous dialog pChoiceId is in relation to
      rewardStat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!! this stat will be the one to be rewarded + or -
      rewardVal - is the value that the stat will increase or decrease by
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you clear the requirements
      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements

    • addOptionPreviousRewardEnding

      public void addOptionPreviousRewardEnding​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, int pChoiceId, int pDialogBoxId, String rewardStat, int rewardVal, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId, boolean endOnSuccess, int endingScreenId)
      Creates a dialog with a reward for a stat, if you have chosen a specific option previously this ends the game
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"
      pChoiceId - is the id of the previous option having to be chosen for it to go to successDialogBoxId
      pDialogBoxId - is the id of the previous dialog pChoiceId is in relation to
      rewardStat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!! this stat will be the one to be rewarded + or -
      rewardVal - is the value that the stat will increase or decrease by
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you clear the requirements
      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements
      endOnSuccess - is a boolean value where true means the game ends if u clear the requirements, false means the game ends if u fail the requirements
      endingScreenId - is the id for the ending screen that will be shown

    • addOptionPreviousRequirementReward

      public void addOptionPreviousRequirementReward​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, int pChoiceId, int pDialogBoxId, String stat, int statVal, String rewardStat, int rewardVal, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId)
      Creates an option where you need to have chosen an option previously, and meet the stat requirements for it, with a reward.
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"
      pChoiceId - is the id of the previous option having to be chosen for it to go to successDialogBoxId
      pDialogBoxId - is the id of the previous dialog pChoiceId is in relation to
      stat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!!
      statVal - is the value of what your stat has to be greater than or equal to >=
      rewardStat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!! this stat will be the one to be rewarded + or -
      rewardVal - is the value that the stat will increase or decrease by
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you clear the requirements
      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements

    • addOptionPreviousRequirementRewardEnding

      public void addOptionPreviousRequirementRewardEnding​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, int pChoiceId, int pDialogBoxId, String stat, int statVal, String rewardStat, int rewardVal, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId, boolean endOnSuccess, int endingScreenId)
      Creates an option where you need to have chosen an option previously, and meet the stat requirements for it, with a reward. this ends the game
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"
      pChoiceId - is the id of the previous option having to be chosen for it to go to successDialogBoxId
      pDialogBoxId - is the id of the previous dialog pChoiceId is in relation to
      stat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!!
      statVal - is the value of what your stat has to be greater than or equal to >=
      rewardStat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!! this stat will be the one to be rewarded + or -
      rewardVal - is the value that the stat will increase or decrease by
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you clear the requirements
      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements
      endOnSuccess - is a boolean value where true means the game ends if u clear the requirements, false means the game ends if u fail the requirements
      endingScreenId - is the id for the ending screen that will be shown

    • addOptionWithRequirement

      public void addOptionWithRequirement​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, String stat, int statVal, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId)
      Creates a dialog with a requirement of a stat having to be greater than or equal to n
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"
      stat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!!
      statVal - is the value of what your stat has to be greater than or equal to >=
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you clear the requirements
      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements

    • addOptionWithRequirementEnding

      public void addOptionWithRequirementEnding​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, String stat, int statVal, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId, boolean endOnSuccess, int endingScreenId)
      Creates a dialog with a requirement of a stat having to be greater than or equal to n this ends the game
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"

      statVal - is the value of what your stat has to be greater than or equal to >=

      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements
      endOnSuccess - is a boolean value where true means the game ends if u clear the requirements, false means the game ends if u fail the requirements

    • addOptionWithRequirementReward

      public void addOptionWithRequirementReward​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, String stat, int statVal, String rewardStat, int rewardVal, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId)
      Creates an option where you have a stat requirement and reward a stat for clearing the requirement
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"
      stat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!!
      statVal - is the value of what your stat has to be greater than or equal to >=
      rewardStat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!! this stat will be the one to be rewarded + or -
      rewardVal - is the value that the stat will increase or decrease by
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you clear the requirements
      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements

    • addOptionWithRequirementRewardEnding

      public void addOptionWithRequirementRewardEnding​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, String stat, int statVal, String rewardStat, int rewardVal, int successDialogBoxId, int failDialogBoxId, boolean endOnSuccess, int endingScreenId)
      Creates an option where you have a stat requirement and reward a stat for clearing the requirement this ends the game
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed for example: "I chose 1 in dialog 3"
      stat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!!
      statVal - is the value of what your stat has to be greater than or equal to >=
      rewardStat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!! this stat will be the one to be rewarded + or -
      rewardVal - is the value that the stat will increase or decrease by
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you clear the requirements
      failDialogBoxId - is the next dialog if you did not clear the requirements
      endOnSuccess - is a boolean value where true means the game ends if u clear the requirements, false means the game ends if u fail the requirements
      endingScreenId - is the id for the ending screen that will be shown

    • addOptionWithReward

      public void addOptionWithReward​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, String rewardStat, int rewardVal, int successDialogBoxId)
      Creates an option where you reward a stat
      Parameters:
      id - is the id for this current option
      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed
      rewardStat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!! this stat will be the one to be rewarded + or -
      rewardVal - is the value that the stat will increase or decrease by
      successDialogBoxId - is the next dialog

    • addOptionWithRewardEnding

      public void addOptionWithRewardEnding​(int id, int dialogBoxId, String content, String rewardStat, int rewardVal, int endingScreenId)

      dialogBoxId - is the id of the dialog it is in relation to.
      content - is the text that will be displayed
      rewardStat - is the name of the stat used in character creation, this is case-sensitive!!! this stat will be the one to be rewarded + or -
      rewardVal - is the value that the stat will increase or decrease by
      endingScreenId - is the id for the ending screen that will be shown

    • finishStory

      public void finishStory()
      You have to use this function under all of your Dialog and Choices, and right before Launch(); This function finishes your story and makes a .json containing the entire story with all the options

    • getId

      public int getId()
      This gets used by Jackson.databind to make JSON Files.

      public String getContent()
      This gets used by Jackson.databind to make JSON Files.

      This gets used by Jackson.databind to make JSON Files.

      This gets used by Jackson.databind to make JSON Files.
